title-part.text: CRIMPING OR CURLING FIBRES, FILAMENTS, THREADS, OR YARNS
YARNS OR THREADS

note.note-paragraph: Attention is drawn to the note following the title of class D02
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Producing crimped or curled fibres, filaments, yarns, or threads, giving them latent characteristics

reference.text: yarns per se D02G3/00; during formation of artificial filaments, threads, or the like D01D5/22; general aspects of chemical treatment D06M

note.note-paragraph: In the context of this group, the terms "texturing" or "texturising" encompass curling and crimping

CPC-specific-text.text: by knitting, weaving or tufting, fixing and then unravelling
by heating fibres, filaments, yarns or threads so as to create a temperature gradient across their diameter, thereby imparting them latent asymmetrical shrinkage properties
by impinging the yarn against an uneven surface and thereby deforming it
with provision for imparting irregular effects to the yarn

title-part.text: by twisting, fixing the twist and backtwisting, i.e. by imparting false twist

CPC-specific-text.text: by false-twisting
after drawing the yarn on the same machine
while simultaneously drawing the yarn
multiple false-twisting
with real twist being imparted to the yarn before or after false-twisting
with provision for imparting irregular effects to the yarn
at least some of the filaments being simultaneously broken or cut, e.g. by stretching or abrading
while bonding at least some of the filaments or fibres together
in the presence of a crimp finish
false-twisting machines
threading up and starting the false-twisting machine
by twisting or false-twisting at least two filaments, yarns or threads, fixing the twist and separating the filaments, yarns or threads
characterised by the use of certain filaments, fibres or yarns
composed, at least in part, of natural fibres

title-part.text: Devices for imparting false twist
Spindles
Rollers

CPC-specific-text.text: or other friction causing elements
with the periphery of at least one disc
between crossed belts
between the flanks of rotating discs

title-part.text: using knife edges, e.g. heated knife edges, for edge crimping
using stuffer boxes

CPC-specific-text.text: introducing the filaments in the stuffer box by means of a fluid jet
including means for monitoring or controlling yarn processing
including drawing or stretching on the same machine

title-part.text: using grooved rollers or gear-wheel-type members
using jets or streams of turbulent gases, e.g. air, steam

reference.text: interlacing filaments D02J1/08

CPC-specific-text.text: yarn crimping air jets
with provision for imparting irregular effects to the yarn
in the presence of a liquid, e.g. a crimp finish
characterised by the use of certain filaments or yarns
including means for monitoring or controlling yarn processing
including drawing or stretching on the same machine

title-part.text: by combining fibres, filaments, or yarns, having different shrinkage characteristics

reference.text: D02G1/004 takes precedence

title-part.text: Combinations of two or more of the above-mentioned operations or devices
After-treatments for fixing crimp or curl

CPC-specific-text.text: After-treatments for fixing crimp or curl

title-part.text: Yarns or threads, e.g. fancy yarns
Processes or apparatus for the production thereof, not otherwise provided for

reference.text: for producing crimped or curled yarns D02G1/00

note.note-paragraph: In this main group, further classification in indexing scheme D10B for aspects relating to yarns is required.

title-part.text: Yarns or threads characterised by the material or by the materials from which they are made

CPC-specific-text.text: Yarns or threads formed from hair

reference.text: horse-hair threads D02G3/14

title-part.text: Blended or other yarns or threads containing components made from different materials

CPC-specific-text.text: all components being made from natural material
all components being made from artificial or synthetic material
including aramid fibres

title-part.text: Threads formed from strip material other than paper
Paper yarns or threads
Yarns or threads formed from collagenous materials, e.g. catgut

reference.text: surgical threads or yarns A61L

title-part.text: Threads containing metallic filaments or strips
Horse-hair threads
Yarns or threads made from mineral substances
from glass or the like

CPC-specific-text.text: the glass being present only in part of the structure
in the core
in the sheath

title-part.text: from asbestos
Yarns or threads characterised by constructional features

CPC-specific-text.text: , e.g. blending, filament/fibre

reference.text: piecing of yarns or threads D01H15/00

title-part.text: Bulked yarns or threads, e.g. formed from staple fibre components with different relaxation characteristics
with characteristics dependent on the amount or direction of twist
Doubled, plied, or cabled threads

reference.text: D02G3/32, D02G3/36 take precedence; effect yarns D02G3/34; details of spindles, e.g. bearings D01H7/86

CPC-specific-text.text: using one drawing frame for two slivers and twisting of the slivers to a single yarn, i.e. spin-twisting

reference.text: guides having associated actuators with mutual action D01H13/1658

CPC-specific-text.text: using hollow spindles through which one yarn is running
one yarn running over the feeding spool of another yarn
with alternatively "S" and "Z" direction of twist, e.g. Self-twist process
with same direction of twist, but with an amount of twist varying along the thread

title-part.text: Crêped or other highly-twisted yarns or threads
Elastic yarns or threads

CPC-specific-text.text: ; Production of plied or cored yarns, one of which is elastic
using hollow spindles

reference.text: details of spindles, e.g. bearings D01H7/86

CPC-specific-text.text: using a drawing frame
the elastic properties due to the construction rather than to the use of elastic material
containing elastane

title-part.text: Yarns or threads having slubs, knops, spirals, loops, tufts, or other irregular or decorative effects, i.e. effect yarns

reference.text: carding machines for producing decorative or fancy effects in products D01G; drafting machines with varying draft according to a pre-arranged pattern D01H5/36

CPC-specific-text.text: using hollow spindles

reference.text: details of spindles, e.g. bearings D01H7/86

CPC-specific-text.text: with coloured effects, i.e. by differential dyeing process

title-part.text: Cored or coated yarns or threads

CPC-specific-text.text: D02G3/34, D02G3/40 take precedence

reference.text: ; elastic yarns or threads D02G3/32

CPC-specific-text.text: using hollow spindles

reference.text: details of spindles, e.g. bearings D01H7/86

CPC-specific-text.text: around which a reel supporting feeding spool rotates
using a drawing frame

title-part.text: Threads in which fibres, filaments, or yarns are wound with other yarns or filaments,

CPC-specific-text.text: e.g. wrap yarns, i.e. strands of filaments or staple fibres are wrapped by a helically wound binder yarn;

reference.text: D02G3/32 takes precedence
covering endless core threads with fibres by using open-end spinning techniques D01H4/00

CPC-specific-text.text: using hollow spindles, e.g. making coverspun yarns

title-part.text: Yarns in which fibres are united by adhesives
Impregnated yarns or threads

CPC-specific-text.text: the adhesive being one component of the yarn, i.e. thermoplastic yarn
Yarns or threads coated with polymeric solutions
where the polymeric solution is removable at a later stage, e.g. by washing
Flocked yarns

title-part.text: Chenille threads
Yarns or threads characterised by the purpose for which they are designed

reference.text: protective gloves A41D19/00; protective clothing A62B17/00; ropes D07B1/02

CPC-specific-text.text: Yarns or threads with antistatic, conductive or radiation-shielding properties

reference.text: electroconductive, anti-static or radiation-shielding filaments D01F1/09, D01F1/106; anti-static fabrics D03D15/533; conducting, insulating or anti-static layers for floor coverings D06N7/0042

CPC-specific-text.text: Cut or abrasion resistant yarns or threads
Heat-resistant, fireproof or flame-retardant yarns or threads

reference.text: fire- or flame-proof filaments D01F1/07; woven fabrics using heat-resistant or fireproof threads D03D15/513

CPC-specific-text.text: Yarns or threads for use in sports applications

reference.text: strings for tennis rackets A63B51/02

CPC-specific-text.text: Yarns or threads for use in floor fabrics

reference.text: floor fabrics A47G27/00; floor coverings on textile basis D06N7/0005

CPC-specific-text.text: Yarns or threads for use in automotive applications
Yarns or threads for specific use in general industrial applications, e.g. as filters or reinforcement
Yarns or threads for use in medical applications

reference.text: D02G3/449 takes precedence; surgical suture materials A61L17/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Yarns or threads with antibacterial properties

reference.text: filaments containing agents inhibiting growth of microorganisms D01F1/103

title-part.text: Sewing-cottons or the like
Tyre cords

reference.text: tyre reinforcements B60C9/00; metal cords for reinforcing rubber or plastic articles D07B1/0606
